entries.meaning: (historical, military) Any horse used in horse-cavalry, but especially one bearing an armoured knight.
(figurative, informal) An experienced person who has been through many battles, situations or contests; someone who has given long service.
examples: Synonyms: old hand, swashbuckler, veteran, workhorse

entries.meaning: (theater, music) A regularly revived theatrical or musical work, as with Hamlet or a Beethoven symphony, or as excerpts thereto. May imply that the work in question has become hackneyed.
